source_sentence: ◎「爾時太子至年十歲，諸釋種中，五百童子，皆亦同年。
translation: At the time, the prince was ten years old, and among the five hundred children of the Śākyas, they all had the same age.

source_sentence: 太子從弟提婆達多，次名難陀，次名孫陀羅難陀等；
translation: The prince followed his younger brother Devadatta; the next name was Nanda, and the second named Sundarananda.

source_sentence: 或有三十相、三十一相者，或復雖有三十二相，相不分明；
translation: “Sometimes there are thirty characteristic marks and thirty-one characteristic marks”: Again, sometimes even though there are thirty-two characteristic marks, the characteristic marks are not clearly distinguished.

source_sentence: 各閑伎藝，有大筋力。
translation: Each was engaged in performing arts and crafts but possessed great strength.

source_sentence: 時提婆達多等五百童子，既聞太子諸藝皆通，名徹十方，共相謂言：『太子雖復聰明智慧，
translation: When Devadatta and the five hundred other children had heard that the prince’s knowledge of arts and crafts extended to all people in the ten directions, they said among themselves, “Even though the prince may be intelligent and wise,

source_sentence: 善解書論，至於力膂，詎勝我等！』
translation: Well-versed in books and treatises, they're superior to us in terms of strength and strength!'

source_sentence: 欲與太子較其勇健。
translation: He wanted to compare him to the prince's courage and strength.

source_sentence: 爾時父王，又訪國中善知射者，而召之來，令教太子，即往後園，欲射鐵鼓；
translation: At that time the king’s father, who was also well versed in marksmanship, summoned the archer and ordered him to teach the prince.

source_sentence: 提婆達多等五百童子，亦悉隨從。
translation: Devadatta and the five hundred other children all followed him.

source_sentence: 時師即便授一小弓而與太子，太子含笑而問之言：『以此與我，欲作何等？』
translation: The teacher then gave a small bow to the prince, and the prince smiled and asked him, 'What do you want me to do with this?'

source_sentence: 射師答言：『欲令太子射此鐵鼓。』
translation: The archer replied, 'I want to cause the prince to shoot this iron drum.'

source_sentence: 太子又言：『此弓力弱，更求如是七弓將來。』
translation: The prince also said, 'This bow is weak; I'll ask for another such seven bows in the future.'

source_sentence: 師即授與，太子便執七弓，以射一箭，過七鐵鼓。
translation: The teacher then gave it to him, and the prince took seven bowmen and shot one arrow more than seven iron drums.

source_sentence: 時彼射師，往白王言：『大王！
translation: The archer then went to the king and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 太子自知射藝，以一箭力，射過七鼓，閻浮提中無能等者。
translation: The prince knew the art of archery, and with the power of a single arrow he shot beyond seven drums, which no one in Jambudvfpa could equal.

source_sentence: 云何令我為作師耶？』
translation: How will you cause me to become a teacher?'

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王聞此語已，心大歡喜，而自念言：『我子聰明，書論算數四遠悉知；
translation: Having heard these words, King Baijing was greatly delighted and thought to himself:

source_sentence: 而其射藝四方人民，未有知者。』
translation: But there's no one who knows the people in the four directions who practice archery.'

source_sentence: 即勅太子及提婆達多等五百童子，又復擊鼓唱令國界：『太子薩婆悉達，
translation: He ordered the prince and Devadatta, together with five hundred other children, to beat their drums and announce to the whole empire:

source_sentence: 却後七日當出後園，欲試武藝；
translation: Seven days after his departure, he was to leave the rear garden in order to test his martial arts.

source_sentence: 諸人民中有勇力者，可悉來此。』
translation: If there's courage among the people, they can all come here.'

source_sentence: 到第七日，提婆達多與六萬眷屬，最先出城。
translation: On the seventh day, Devadatta and 60,000 members of his retinue were the first to leave the city.

source_sentence: 于時有一大象，當城門住，此諸軍眾，皆不敢前，提婆達多問諸人言：『何故住此而不前耶？』
translation: When a large elephant was standing at the city gate, these soldiers didn't dare to go forward, and Devadatta asked the people, 'Why are you staying here but not going forward?'

source_sentence: 諸人答言：『有一大象，當門而立，舉眾畏之，故不敢前。』
translation: The people replied, 'There's a large elephant standing at the entrance and raising fear in the crowd, so they won't dare to go there.'

source_sentence: 提婆達多聞此言已，獨前象所，以手搏頭，即便躃地；
translation: Having heard these words, Devadatta went alone to the elephant in front of him. Patting his head against the elephant’s neck with his hand, he fell to the ground.

source_sentence: 於是軍眾次第得過。
translation: Thereupon, the army of monks and nuns passed by in order.

source_sentence: 爾時難陀又與眷屬亦欲出城，其諸軍眾徐步漸前，難陀即問：『何故行遲？』
translation: It was then that Nanda and his retinue also wanted to leave the city, and his army gradually advanced, so Nanda asked, 'Why are you walking so slowly?'

source_sentence: 諸人答言：『提婆達多手搏一象，躃在城門，妨行者路，以是故遲。』
translation: The people answered, 'Devadatta's hand wrestled an elephant, and the arrow was at the city gate that obstructed the way for those who traveled; therefore, it was late.'

source_sentence: 難陀即便前至象所，以足指挑象，擲著路傍；
translation: Nanda approached the elephant, picked it up with his feet and tossed it at the side of the road.

source_sentence: 無數人眾，聚共看之。
translation: Countless people gathered together to see it.

source_sentence: 爾時太子與十萬眷屬，前後圍繞，始出城門，見於路傍人眾聚看即便問曰：『此諸人輩，
translation: At that time the prince and his one hundred thousand attendants came out of the city gates, surrounded in front and behind him. Seeing the crowd on the street corners, they asked:

source_sentence: 為何所看？』
translation: What's the point of seeing?'

source_sentence: 從人答言：『提婆達多手搏一象，躃在城門，妨人行路；
translation: The attendants replied, “Devadatta is beating an elephant in his hand. His carriage is at the entrance of the city gates and prevents people from walking on the streets.

source_sentence: 難陀次出，以足指挑擲著於此，是故行人悉聚看之。』
translation: Nandana came out in order and tossed it here with his feet, so the practitioners gathered together to see it.'

source_sentence: 於是太子即自念言：『今者正是現力之時。』
translation: The prince then thought to himself, 'Now is the right time for me to show my strength.'

source_sentence: 太子便即以手執象，擲著城外，還以手接，不令傷損；
translation: The prince then took the elephant in his hand and tossed it outside the city wall. He touched it again with his own hand so that it would not be harmed.

source_sentence: 象又還穌，無所苦痛。
translation: The elephant reappeared, feeling no pain and suffering.

source_sentence: 時諸人民，歎未曾有。
translation: The people then praised it as unprecedented.

source_sentence: 王聞此已，深生奇特。
translation: Having heard this, the king was deeply surprised and wondered.

source_sentence: 「如是太子及提婆達多并與難陀，四遠人民，皆悉來集，在彼園中。
translation: “Thus, the princes, Devadatta and Nanda, as well as the people of the four distant lands, all gathered in that park.

source_sentence: 爾時彼園，種種莊嚴，施列金鼓、銀鼓、鍮石之鼓、銅鐵等鼓，各有七枚。
translation: At the time, that park was variously adorned, and it was lined with golden drums, silver drums, brass drums, copper drums, iron drums, and so forth, each of which had seven drums.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆達多，最先射之，徹三金鼓；
translation: At that time Devadatta was the first to shoot at it, penetrating through three golden drums.

source_sentence: 次及難陀，亦徹三鼓；
translation: The next and Nanda also penetrated the three drums.

source_sentence: 諸來人眾，悉皆雅歎。
translation: All the people who came to the monastery praised it.

source_sentence: 爾時群臣，白太子言：『提婆達多及與難陀，皆已射訖，今者次第正在太子，
translation: It was then that the ministers said to the crown prince, “Devadatta and Nanda have all shot.

source_sentence: 唯願太子射此諸鼓。』
translation: Please, prince, let's shoot these drums.'

source_sentence: 如是三請，太子曰：『善！』
translation: After these three requests, the prince said, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 而語之言：『若欲使我射諸鼓者，此弓力弱，更覓強者。』
translation: He said, 'If you want me to shoot the drums, this bow is weak; I'll look for someone stronger.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『太子祖王有一良弓，今在王庫。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'There's a good bow in the king's treasury for princes and patriarchs.'

source_sentence: 太子語言：『便可取來。』
translation: The prince said, 'Should you take it?'

source_sentence: 弓既至已，太子即牽以放一箭，徹過諸鼓，然後入池，泉水流出，又亦穿過大鐵圍山。
translation: When the bow had arrived, the prince drew it and released an arrow that penetrated all the drums. Then he entered a pond with water flowing out of its fountain and passed beyond the great ring of iron mountains as well.

source_sentence: 「爾時提婆達多又與難陀，共相撲戲，二人力等，亦無勝者。
translation: At the time, Devadatta and Nanda were also playing wrestling together with each other, and there was no one superior to them in terms of strength.

source_sentence: 太子又前，手執二弟，躃之於地，以慈力故不令傷痛。
translation: The prince then went on, took his two younger brothers in his hand, and crushed them to the ground so that they wouldn't be hurt by the power of kindness.

source_sentence: 爾時四遠諸人民眾，既見太子有如此力，高聲唱言：『白淨王太子，非但智慧勝一切人，
translation: Seeing the prince thus empowered, the people in the four distant directions shouted loudly, “Your majesty, not only is your wisdom superior to that of all people,

source_sentence: 其力勇健亦無等者。』
translation: Their strength and courage are also unequaled.'

source_sentence: 莫不歎伏，益生恭敬。
translation: They all praised and subdued him, increasing their respect.

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王，即會諸臣而共議言：『太子今者年已長大，智慧勇健，
translation: At that moment, King Śubhavyūha assembled his ministers and said in unison, “O prince, you are now grown into an adult.

source_sentence: 皆悉具足，今宜應以四大海水灌太子頂。』
translation: They're all fully endowed, so now it's appropriate to pour the prince's head over his head with the four great oceans of water.'

source_sentence: 又復勅下餘小國王：『却後二月八日，灌太子頂，皆可來集。』
translation: Again, he instructed the other kings of the small countries to say, 'On the eighth day of the second month, they'll consecrate the prince's head and assemble them all.'

source_sentence: 至二月八日，諸餘國王并及仙人婆羅門等，皆悉雲集。
translation: On the eighth day of the second month, all the other kings and sages, brahmans, and others gathered in great numbers.

source_sentence: 懸繒幡蓋，燒香散花，鳴鍾擊鼓，作諸伎樂；
translation: They hung silken banners and canopies, burned incense, scattered flowers, sounded bells and beat the drums, and played music.

source_sentence: 以七寶器，盛四海水，諸仙人眾，各各頂戴授婆羅門；
translation: He filled the four great oceans of water with vessels made of the seven kinds of treasure. Each of the holy ones carried a buddha image on their heads and taught it to the brahman.

source_sentence: 如是乃至遍及諸臣，悉已頂戴，傳授與王。
translation: Thus, it's up to pervading and the ministers who have all worn it on their heads and transmitted it to the king.

source_sentence: 時王即以灌太子頂，以七寶印而用付之，又擊大鼓，高聲唱言：『今立薩婆悉達以為太子。』
translation: The king then poured it over the prince's head, gave it to him with a seven-jeweled seal, beat another great drum, and shouted loudly, saying, 'Now, I'll posit Sāvatṛta as the prince.'

source_sentence: 爾時虛空天、龍、夜叉、人非人等，作天伎樂，異口同音讚言：『善哉！』
translation: It was then that the sky gods, dragons, yakṣas, humans, and non-humans made heavenly music and praised it in unison, saying, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 當於迦毘羅斾兜國立太子時，餘八國王，亦於是日同立太子。
translation: When he was the prince of Kapilavastu, the kings of the other eight kingdoms also established a prince on that day.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，啟王出遊，王即聽許。
translation: It was then that the prince asked the king to leave, and the king agreed to allow him to do so.

source_sentence: 時王即與太子并諸群臣，前後導從，按行國界，次復前行；
translation: The king, accompanied by the crown prince and his ministers, led the procession in front and behind him. Traveling along the boundary of the empire, they advanced one after another.

source_sentence: 到王田所，即便止息，閻浮樹下，看諸耕人。
translation: When he arrived at the king's field, he stopped and stood under a Jambudvīpa tree to look out for the plowingmen.

source_sentence: 爾時淨居天，化作壤蟲，烏隨啄之。
translation: At the time, the Śuddhāvāsa gods transformed themselves into soil worms and crows followed them to peck at them.

source_sentence: 太子見已，起慈悲心，眾生可愍，互相吞食；
translation: Seeing this, the prince became compassionate and sympathetic. All sentient beings were pitiable and swallowed each other’s food.

source_sentence: 即便思惟：『離欲界愛，如是乃至得四禪地。』
translation: He even thought, 'I'll part with the desire for the desire realm and thus attain the fourth meditative state.'

source_sentence: 日光昕赫，樹為曲枝，隨蔭太子。
translation: The sun was shining brilliantly and the trees were crooked, providing shade for the prince.

source_sentence: 爾時白淨王，四面推求，問覓太子；
translation: It was then that King Baijing searched all sides to find the prince.

source_sentence: 從人答曰：『太子今在閻浮樹下。』
translation: The man replied, 'Now, prince, I'm at the foot of a Jambudvīpa tree.'

source_sentence: 時王即便與諸群臣，往彼樹所，未至之間，遙見太子端坐思惟，又見彼樹曲蔭其軀，
translation: The king and his ministers then went to the tree. Before they arrived there, he saw the prince sitting cross-legged in meditation from a distance and saw the tree shading him.

source_sentence: 深生奇特。
translation: It's profound and marvelous.

source_sentence: 時王即前執太子手問言：『汝今何故在於此坐？』
translation: The king then took the prince's hand and asked, 'Why are you sitting here now?'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『觀諸眾生，更相吞食，甚可傷愍。』
translation: The prince answered, 'Look at the sentient beings who swallow each other's food, which is so painful and debilitating.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心生憂惱，慮其出家，宜急婚娉以悅其意，即便呼之：『俱共還國。』
translation: When the king heard these words, his mind became sad and distressed, worried about leaving home, and it was advisable to quickly marry and be married to please his wishes, so he even called out to them, 'We'll both return to our country.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『願停於此。』
translation: The prince answered, 'May I stop here.'

source_sentence: 王聞其語，心即念言：『彼阿私陀往日所說，太子今者將如其言。』
translation: When the king heard his words, he thought to himself, 'That was what Asita said in the past, and now the prince will follow his words.'

source_sentence: 王即流淚重喚：『還國。』
translation: The king then wept and repeatedly called out, 'Return to your country.'

source_sentence: 太子既見父王如此，即便隨從，歸於所止。
translation: Seeing this, the prince followed his father and returned to where he was staying.

source_sentence: 王恐愁憂，不樂在家，更增妓女，而娛樂之。
translation: Fearful and distressed, the king did not wish to stay at home but instead increased the number of court ladies to entertain him.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，至年十七，王集諸臣，而共議言：『太子今者年已長大，
translation: At that time, when the prince was seventeen years old, the king gathered his ministers together to discuss the matter among themselves, saying:

source_sentence: 宜應為其訪索婚所。』
translation: It's appropriate for him to visit the place where he asks for his marriage.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『有一釋種婆羅門，名摩訶那摩，其人有女，名耶輸陀羅，
translation: The ministers replied, “There was a brahman of the Śākya clan called Mahānāma. He had a daughter named Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 顏容端正，聰明智慧，賢才過人，禮儀備舉，有如是德，堪太子妃。』
translation: Their appearance is correct, intelligent and wise, their talents are superior to those of others, and their manner is well-maintained; they have such virtue that they can be the prince's consort.'

source_sentence: 王即答言：『若如卿語，便為納之。』
translation: The king then answered, 'If it's as you say, I'll accept it for you.'

source_sentence: 王還宮內，即勅宮中聰明有智舊宿女人：『汝可往至摩訶那摩長者之家，
translation: When the king returned to his palace, he summoned the wise and intelligent old constellate queen of the palace:

source_sentence: 瞻看其女，容儀禮行，為何如耶？
translation: He looked at her and saw how she was dressed.

source_sentence: 可停於彼至滿七日。』
translation: You can stop there for seven days.'

source_sentence: 受王勅已，即便往彼長者之家，於七日中，具觀此女。
translation: After receiving the king's command, he went to that elder's house and observed this woman for seven days.

source_sentence: 還答王言：『我觀此女，容貌端正，威儀進止，無與等者。』
translation: Again, the king answered, 'I've observed that this woman's appearance is correct and her manner is such that there's nothing like it.'

source_sentence: 王聞其言，極大歡喜，即便遣人語摩訶那摩言：『太子年長，欲為納妃。』
translation: When the king heard his words, he was overjoyed and sent someone to Mahānāma to say, 'The prince is old enough to accept the queen.'

source_sentence: 諸臣並言：『汝女淑令，宜堪此舉，今欲相屈。』
translation: The ministers all said, 'It's advisable for you women to be able to do so, but now I want to bend over backwards.'

source_sentence: 時摩訶那摩，答王使言：『謹奉勅旨。』
translation: Mahānāma then answered the king's messenger, saying, 'I respectfully submit to your command.'

source_sentence: 王即令諸臣擇採吉日，遣車萬乘，而往迎之。
translation: The king then ordered his ministers to choose an auspicious day and sent a chariot drawn by ten thousand carriages to meet him.

source_sentence: 既至宮已，具足太子婚姻之禮，又復更增諸妓女眾，晝夜娛樂。
translation: When they arrived at the palace, they prepared the ceremonies for the prince’s marriage and also increased the number of court ladies to amuse themselves day and night.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，恒與其妃，行、住、坐、臥，未曾不俱；
translation: At that time the prince always accompanied his queen, neither walking, standing, sitting, or lying down; he never did not accompany her.

source_sentence: 初自無有世俗之意，於靜夜中，但修禪觀。
translation: At first, he had no worldly thoughts of his own, but cultivated meditation and contemplation in the middle of a quiet night.

source_sentence: 時王日日問諸婇女：『太子與妃，相接近不？』
translation: Day after day, the king asked the court ladies, 'Is the prince and the queen approaching each other?'

source_sentence: 婇女答言：『不見太子有夫婦道。』
translation: The promiscuous woman replied, 'I don't see the prince as a husband and wife.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，愁憂不樂，更增妓女，而娛樂之；
translation: When the king heard these words, he was overcome with sorrow and unhappy. He increased the number of court ladies to entertain him.

source_sentence: 如是經時，猶不接近，時王深疑恐不能男。
translation: At the time of this sūtra, he still didn't approach it, and the king was deeply doubtful that he couldn't be a man.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，聞諸妓女歌詠，園林花果茂盛，流泉清涼，太子忽便欲出遊觀；
translation: At that time the prince heard the court ladies singing, and the park was full of flowers and fruit. The stream running water in the spring was clear and cool.

source_sentence: 即遣妓女，往白王言：『在宮日久，樂欲暫出園林遊戲。』
translation: He then sent a courtesan to the king and said, 'I've been in the palace for a long time, and I'm happy to leave the garden and play for a while.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心生歡喜，而自念言：『太子當是不樂在宮行夫婦禮，所以求出園林去耳。』
translation: When the king heard these words, his heart rejoiced and thought to himself, 'The prince won't delight in performing married ceremonies at the palace; therefore, he asks to leave the garden and leave it.'

source_sentence: 即便聽之，勅諸群臣：『整治園觀，所經道路，皆令清淨。』
translation: He even listened to them and instructed his ministers, 'Implement the park and the paths that lead through it so that they're all made pure.'

source_sentence: 太子即便往至王所頭面禮足，辭出而去。
translation: The prince then went to the king, bowed his forehead at his feet, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 時王即便勅一舊臣聰明智慧善言辯者，令從太子。
translation: The king then ordered an old minister who was intelligent, wise, and eloquent to follow the prince's example.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，與諸官屬，前後導從，出城東門，國中人民，聞太子出，男女盈路，
translation: The prince, accompanied by his officials and attendants, came out of the city at the east gate. The citizens of the country heard that the prince was coming out, and men and women were filling the road.

source_sentence: 觀者如雲。
translation: The contemplation is like a cloud.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作老人，頭白背傴，拄杖羸步。
translation: The Śuddhāvāsa gods then transformed themselves into old men with white hair on their heads and backs, weakened by walking on canes.

source_sentence: 太子即便問從者言：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince then asked the attendant, 'What's this person?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『此老人也。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'That's the old man.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為老。』
translation: The prince also asked, 'What's meant by old age?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『此人昔日曾經嬰兒童子少年，遷謝不住，遂至根熟，形變色衰，
translation: He replied, 'In the past, this man used to be a baby boy. When he was young, he moved away and didn't stay there. As a result, his faculties matured and his appearance declined.

source_sentence: 飲食不消，氣力虛微，坐起苦極，餘命無幾，故謂為老。』
translation: When food and drink aren't digested, energy is weak, pain arises from sitting, and the remaining life isn't long; therefore, it's called old age.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『唯此人老？
translation: The prince asked again, 'Is this person the only old one?'

source_sentence: 一切皆然？』
translation: Is everything the same?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『一切皆悉應當如此。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'All of them should be like this.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，聞是語已，生大苦惱，而自念言：『日月流邁，時變歲移，
translation: Having heard these words, the prince was greatly distressed and thought to himself:

source_sentence: 老至如電，身安足恃！
translation: Their old age is as great as a flash of lightning, and their bodies are peaceful and their feet rely on them!

source_sentence: 我雖富貴，豈獨免耶？
translation: Even though I am wealthy and powerful, how could I be the only one who escapes?

source_sentence: 云何世人，而不怖畏？』
translation: How are the people of the world not afraid?'

source_sentence: 太子從本以來，不樂處世，又聞此事，益生厭離；
translation: Ever since the distant past, the prince did not delight in living in the world. When he heard this story again, his disgust grew and he became disillusioned with it.

source_sentence: 即迴車還，愁思不樂。
translation: He immediately returned in his chariot, feeling disheartened and unhappy.

source_sentence: 時王聞已，心懷煎憂，恐其學道；
translation: Having heard this, the king was greatly grieved and feared that he might become a follower of Buddhism.

source_sentence: 更增妓女，以娛樂之。
translation: They also increased the number of court ladies to entertain them.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，復經少時，啟王出遊。

source_sentence: 王聞此言，心生憂慮，而自念言：『太子前出，逢見老人，憂愁不樂，
translation: Having heard these words, the king was greatly distressed and thought to himself, “The prince came out in front of me.

source_sentence: 今者云何，而復求出？』
translation: What's the point of seeking to leave now?'

source_sentence: 王愛太子，不忍違異，僶俛從之；
translation: The king loved the prince and could not bear to disobey him.

source_sentence: 即集諸臣，而共議言：『太子前者出城東門，逢見老人，還輙不樂；

source_sentence: 今者已復求出遊觀，吾不能免，遂復許之。』
translation: Now, I've already asked to leave and go on a tour of the monastery, but I can't avoid it, so I'll allow it again.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『當更嚴勅外諸官屬，修治道路，懸繒幡蓋，散華燒香，皆使華麗，
translation: The ministers replied, “You should strictly order the officials outside the monastery to repair the roads so that they will be adorned with silk banners and canopies, scattering flowers and burning incense.

source_sentence: 無令臭穢諸不淨潔，及以老病在道側也。』
translation: They won't allow smelly and impure things, as well as old age and illness, to be at the side of the path.'

source_sentence: 「爾時迦毘羅斾兜城四門之外，各有一園，樹木花果，浴池樓觀，種種莊嚴，
translation: “At that time, beyond the four gates of Kapilavastu, there was a park with trees, flowers, fruits, bathing ponds, towers, and various adornments.

source_sentence: 皆悉無異。
translation: They are all completely the same.

source_sentence: 王問諸臣：『外諸園觀，何者為勝？』
translation: The king asked the ministers, 'Which of the parks and pavilions outside the palace is superior?'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『外諸園觀，皆等無異，如忉利天歡喜之園。』
translation: The ministers replied, 'The external parks and pavilions are all the same without distinction, like the joyful park of the Trāyastriṃśa gods.'

source_sentence: 王又勅言：『太子前出，已從東門；

translation: Now, we can order them to come out of the south gate.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，百官導從，出城南門。
translation: It was then that the prince, accompanied by a hundred officials, left the south gate of the city.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作病人，身瘦腹大，喘息呻吟，骨消肉竭，顏貌痿黃，舉身戰掉，
translation: At that time the god Śuddhāvāsa transformed himself into a sick man. His body was thin, his abdomen large, and he panted and cried in agony. His bones were crushed and all flesh exhausted, and his complexion looked emaciated and yellow. He trembled as he raised his body.

source_sentence: 不能自持，兩人扶腋，在於路側。
translation: They couldn't carry themselves, and the two men held their armpits at the side of the road.

source_sentence: 太子即問：『此為何人？』
translation: The prince then asked, 'What's this person?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『此病人也。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'This is the sick man.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為病？』
translation: The prince also asked, 'What's meant by illness?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『夫謂病者，皆由嗜欲，飲食無度，四大不調，轉變成病，百節苦痛，
translation: Answer: It's said that a sick person is conditioned by craving, eating and drinking without restraint, the four elements aren't regulated, and it turns into illness, with a hundred knuckles of pain.

source_sentence: 氣力虛微，飲食寡少，眠臥不安，雖有身手，不能自運，要假他力，然後坐起。』
translation: Their energy is weak, there's little food or drink, sleep and lying down are unsettled, and even though they have bodies and hands, they can't carry themselves; they must rely on the power of others to get up after they're seated.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子，以慈悲心，看彼病人，自生愁憂。
translation: The prince then looked after the sick man with compassion, and became grieved.

source_sentence: 又復問言：『此人獨爾？
translation: Again, he asked, 'Is this person alone?'

source_sentence: 餘皆然耶？』
translation: Is the rest all the same?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『一切人民，無有貴賤，同有此病。』
translation: He answered, 'There's no difference between all the people who have this illness and those who don't have it.'

source_sentence: 太子聞已，心自念言：『如此病苦，普應嬰之，云何世人，耽樂不畏？』
translation: After hearing this, the prince thought to himself, 'Such illness and pain are universally associated with birth, so how can people in the world be delighted and not fearful?'

source_sentence: 作此念已，深生恐怖，身心戰動，譬如月影現波浪水。
translation: After he had this thought, he became deeply frightened, and his body and mind trembled in fear, like the shadow of the moon appearing in waves.

source_sentence: 語從者言：『如此身者，是大苦聚，世人於中，撗生歡樂，愚癡無識，
translation: He said to the attendant, “This body is a great mass of suffering. The world will be filled with hatred and rejoice when they see it. They will be ignorant and without consciousness.

source_sentence: 不知覺悟；
translation: They do not know enlightenment.

source_sentence: 今者云何，欲往彼園遊觀嬉戲？』
translation: What's the point of wanting to go to that park and play and contemplate it?'

source_sentence: 即便迴車，還入王宮，坐自思惟，愁憂不樂。
translation: He immediately turned his chariot and returned to the royal palace. Sitting there, he thought to himself:

source_sentence: 王問從者：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』
translation: The king asked the attendant, 'Now that the prince is leaving, how could there be happiness?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『始出南門，逢見病人，以此不樂，即迴車還。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'When I first left the south gate, I met a sick man who didn't like it and turned around in his chariot to return.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心大愁憂，慮其出家。
translation: When the king heard these words, he was greatly distressed and worried that he might leave home.

source_sentence: 時王即便問諸臣言：『太子前者出城東門，逢見老人愁憂不樂，以此事故，
translation: The king then asked his ministers, “Earlier the prince came out of the eastern gate of the city and happened to see an old man who was grieved and unhappy.

source_sentence: 吾勅卿等，淨治道路，無令老病在於巷側，云何今出於城南門，而復致有疾病人耶？
translation: I've instructed you and others to purify the road so that old age and illness won't be at the side of the lane, so why would you now leave the south gate of the city and again cause someone who's sick?

source_sentence: 又令太子逢值見之。』
translation: I'll also cause the prince to meet and see him.'

source_sentence: 諸臣答言：『近受王勅，嚴命外司，勿使有諸臭穢老病在於道側，互相撿覆，
translation: The ministers replied,'Recently I've been instructed by the king to strictly order external officials not to allow smelly old men and illnesses to be at the side of the road and cover each other.

source_sentence: 無敢懈怠，不知何緣忽有病人，非是我等之罪咎也。』
translation: No one dares to be lazy and doesn't know what causes a sick person to suddenly become ill, which isn't the fault of us.'

source_sentence: 爾時王問諸從者言：『汝等並見病人在路何從而至？』
translation: It was then that the king asked the attendants, 'Where did you see the sick man on the road?'

source_sentence: 從者答曰：『無有蹤跡，不知何來？』
translation: The attendant replied, 'There's no trace of it, and I don't know where it comes from.'

source_sentence: 時王深於太子生猶豫心，恐其學道，更增妓女，而悅其意，又復欲使於五欲中生戀著心。
translation: The king then became deeply hesitant with respect to the prince, fearing that he might train in the path and increasing the number of court ladies who delighted him. He also wanted to cause them to become attached to the five desires.

source_sentence: 「爾時有一婆羅門子，名憂陀夷，聰明智慧，極有才辯。
translation: “At the time, there was a Brāhmaṇa boy named Udayana, intelligent and wise, extremely talented and eloquent.

source_sentence: 時王即便請來入宮，而語之言：『太子今者，不樂在世受於五欲，恐其不久，
translation: The king then invited the prince to his palace and said, “Your majesty, I am afraid that it will not be long before you experience the pleasures of the five desires in this world.

source_sentence: 出家學道；
translation: They renounce the householder’s life and study the path.

source_sentence: 汝可與之共作朋屬，具說世間五欲樂事，令其心動不樂出家。』
translation: You can make friends with them and tell them about the five desires and pleasures of the world, so that their minds will be moved and they won't delight in leaving home.'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，即便答言：『太子聰明，無與等者，所知書論，皆悉淵博，
translation: Udayana then replied: Your majesty, the prince is so clever and intelligent that there is nothing like him. He knows all the books and commentaries extensively.

source_sentence: 並是我今所未曾聞，云何見使誘說之耶？
translation: I've never heard of them before, so how can I see and tempt them to teach them?

source_sentence: 譬以藕絲欲懸須彌，我亦如是，終不能迴太子之心。
translation: It's like me wanting to hang Mount Sumeru with a lotus root thread, and so am I, who can't turn my back on the prince's mind.

source_sentence: 大王既勅令作朋友，要當自竭我所知見。』
translation: Since the great king has ordered me to become a friend, I must exhaust my own knowledge and views.'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷受王勅已，隨從太子，行住坐臥，不敢遠離。
translation: Udayana then accepted the king's command and followed the prince, walking, standing, sitting, and lying down, not daring to leave.

source_sentence: 時王又復選諸妓女，聰明智慧，顏容端正，善於歌舞，能惑人者；
translation: The king then again selected the court ladies, intelligent and wise, with beautiful features and good singing and dancing skills to deceive the people.

source_sentence: 種種莊飾，光麗悅目，皆悉遣往給侍太子。
translation: Various kinds of decorations, shining brilliantly and pleasing to the eye, were all sent to serve the prince.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，復經少時，啟王出遊。
translation: “Soon after that, the prince again asked the king to go on a excursion.

source_sentence: 王聞此語，心自念言：『彼優陀夷，既與太子共為朋友，今若出遊，或勝於前，
translation: When the king heard these words, he thought to himself, “That Udāyin had been friends with the prince. Now if he were to go out on a pleasure excursion, it might be better than before.

source_sentence: 無復厭俗樂出家心。』
translation: There's no more disillusionment with worldly pleasures and the mind of leaving home.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即便聽許。
translation: After he had this thought, he even agreed to it.

source_sentence: 時王又復集諸大臣，悉語之言：『太子今者復求出遊，我不忍違，已復聽之；
translation: The king then again assembled his ministers and said to them, “The prince is now going out on an excursion.

source_sentence: 太子前出東南二門，已見老病，還輙憂愁；
translation: The prince came out in front of the southeast through two approaches. Having seen his old age and illness, he was grieved and distressed.

source_sentence: 今者宜令從西門出。
translation: Now, it's advisable to order him to leave through the western gate.

source_sentence: 我心慮其還又不樂；
translation: I thought to myself, “I am afraid they will return but I am not happy.

source_sentence: 然優陀夷，是其良友，冀今出還，不復應爾。
translation: But Udāyin is a good friend of his, and I hope he won't be able to leave or return now.

source_sentence: 卿等好令修治道路園林臺觀，皆使嚴整，香華幡蓋，數倍於前，無令復有老病臭穢在道側也。』
translation: You'd like to make the roads, parks, forests, terraces, and pavilions well-maintained, with fragrant flowers, banners, and canopies several times greater than before, so that there won't be old age, illness, odor, and filth on the side of the road.'

source_sentence: 臣受勅已，即語外司，嚴治道路，并及園林，光麗倍常。
translation: Having received the imperial edict, the courtier told the foreign officials to strictly regulate the roads and all the parks and forests, which were as glorious and beautiful as ever.

source_sentence: 王又先送諸妙妓女，置彼園中；
translation: The king also first sent the beautiful court ladies to that park.

source_sentence: 又復勅語優陀夷言：『若當路側，有不祥事，可以方便誘悅其心。』
translation: Again, he commanded Udayana to say, 'If there's an inauspicious thing at the side of the road, I can skillfully tempt his mind.'

source_sentence: 并勅諸臣，隨從太子，皆令伺察，若有不吉，遠驅逐之。
translation: He also instructed his ministers to follow the prince and ordered them all to search for him. If there was any inauspicious event, he would be driven away from a great distance.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，與優陀夷，百官導從，燒香散花，作眾伎樂，出城西門。
translation: At the time, the prince and Udayana, accompanied by a hundred officials, burned incense, scattered flowers, played music, and left the west gate of the city.

source_sentence: 時淨居天，心自念言：『先現老病於二城門，舉眾皆見，令白淨王嗔責從者并及外司。
translation: The Śuddhāvāsa gods then thought to themselves, 'First, I'll show my old age and illness at the entrance of the two cities, so that all the crowd will see it and tell King Śubhavyūha to angrily rebuke those who follow me and the external officials.

source_sentence: 太子今出，王制嚴峻，我今現死，若皆見者，增王忿怒，必加罰戮抂及無辜；
translation: The prince has now gone forth, but the king is strictly restrained. Now I am about to die. Anyone who sees me dies will surely increase the king’s anger and inevitably be punished with death by slaughter or without guilt.

source_sentence: 我於今日所現之事，唯令太子及憂陀夷二人見耳，使餘官屬不受責也。』
translation: The only thing I'll show today will cause the prince and Udayana to see it, so that the other officials won't be blamed.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，即便來下，化為死人，四人舉輿，以諸香華，布散屍上，室家大小，
translation: Having thought thus, he came down and transformed himself into a dead corpse. The four men raised their carriages and spread scented flowers over the corpse, covering it with all kinds of fragrant cloth.

source_sentence: 號哭送之。
translation: They wailed and cried out in tears to send him off.

source_sentence: 爾時太子與優陀夷，二人獨見。
translation: It was then that the prince and Udayana saw each other alone.

source_sentence: 太子問言：『此為何物？
translation: The prince asked, 'What's this thing?'

source_sentence: 而以花香，莊飾其上，復有人眾，號哭相送。』
translation: It's decorated with flowers and incense, and there are other people crying and wailing to send it off.'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，以王勅故，默然不答。
translation: Because of the king's command, Udayana remained silent and didn't answer.

source_sentence: 如是三問，淨居天王威神之力，使優陀夷不覺答言：『是死人也。』
translation: Thus, these three questions were asked by the authoritative power of the king of the Pure Land gods, so that Udayana didn't perceive them and replied, 'That's a dead man.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂為死？』
translation: The prince also asked, 'What's meant by death?'

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：『夫謂死者，刀風解形，神識去矣，四體諸根，無所復知。
translation: Udāyin said, 'Suppose a dead man's sword and wind dissolve his form, and his spirit and consciousness leave him; the four bodies and faculties no longer know anything.

source_sentence: 此人在世，貪著五欲，愛惜錢財，辛苦經營，唯知積聚，不識無常；
translation: These people in the world are addicted to the five kinds of desire. They cherish money and possessions and work hard for their livelihood. They only know accumulation, but they do not know impermanence.

source_sentence: 今者一旦捨之而死，又為父母親戚眷屬之所愛念；
translation: Now they abandoned them once and died, beloved by their parents, relatives, and other members of their clan.

source_sentence: 命終之後，猶如草木，恩情好惡，不復相關。
translation: At the end of his life, he's like grass and trees, with feelings of kindness and pity that aren't related again.

source_sentence: 如是死者，誠可哀也。』
translation: Such a dead man is really pitiable.'

source_sentence: 太子聞已，心大戰怖。
translation: When the prince heard this, his mind became greatly fearful.

source_sentence: 又問優陀夷言：『唯此人死？
translation: Again, Udāyin asked, 'Is this person the only one who died?'

source_sentence: 餘亦當然？』
translation: The rest are also natural?'

source_sentence: 即復答言：『一切世人，皆應如此，無有貴賤而得免脫。』
translation: He then again answered, 'All people in the world should be like this, with no distinction between noble and humble beings who are liberated.'

source_sentence: 「太子素性，恬靜難動，既聞此語，不能自安。
translation: “The prince’s secular nature is so quiet and immovable that when he hears these words he cannot be at ease.

source_sentence: 即以微聲，語優陀夷：『世間乃復有此死苦，云何於中，而行放逸，心如木石不知怖畏？』
translation: He then spoke to Udayana in a subtle voice, saying, 'There's also this painful suffering of death in the world; why is it that there's such carelessness and laziness like wood and stone in your mind that you don't know fear?'

source_sentence: 即勅御者可迴車還。
translation: He then instructed the king to turn his chariot and return.

source_sentence: 御者答言：『前出二門，未到園所，中路而反，致令大王深見瞋責；
translation: The charioteer answered, “There are two ways to go out of the carriage. Before arriving at the pleasure grove, going back and forth in the middle of the road, I caused the king to become deeply angry with me.

source_sentence: 今者豈敢復如此耶？』
translation: How dare you do so now?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，語御者言：『如汝所說，不應便歸。』
translation: Udayana then said to the king, 'As you say, you shouldn't go back.'

source_sentence: 即復前行，至彼園中，香華幡蓋，作眾伎樂；
translation: So he proceeded on his way and came to the park. There were fragrant flowers, streamers, banners, and canopies as well as various kinds of music played in the park.

source_sentence: 眾妓端正，猶如諸天婇女無異，於太子前，各競歌舞冀以姿態，悅動其意。
translation: The entertainers were all beautiful and handsome, just like heavenly maidens. Each of them competed in singing and dancing before the prince to please him by their appearance.

source_sentence: 太子心安，不可移轉，即止園中，蔭息樹間，除其侍衛，端坐思惟，憶昔曾在閻浮樹下，
translation: The prince’s mind was settled and he could not move. So he stayed in the park, taking a seat under a shady tree to take his rest. Removing his attendants, he sat upright and thought: In the past I used to live under a Jambudvīpa tree.

source_sentence: 遠離欲界，乃至得於第四禪定。
translation: They're free of the desire realm and attain the fourth dhyāna.

source_sentence: 「爾時優陀夷，到太子所，而作此言：『大王見勅，令與太子共為朋友，
translation: At that time, Udāyin came to the prince and said: O great king, having seen this decree, please allow me to associate with you.

source_sentence: 脫有得失，互相開悟，朋友之法，其要有三：一者、見有過失輙相諫曉；
translation: The principle of friendliness consists of three essential parts:

source_sentence: 二者、見有好事，深生隨喜；
translation: The second is that when they see good things, they deeply rejoice.

source_sentence: 三者、在於苦厄，不相棄捨。
translation: 3. In suffering and distress, they don't abandon each other.

source_sentence: 太子云何，永絕不顧？

source_sentence: 以畏老病生死之苦故，於五欲不敢愛著。
translation: Because they fear the suffering of old age, illness, birth, and death, they don't dare to cling to the five desires.

source_sentence: 汝向所言，古昔諸王，先經五欲，然後出家。
translation: As you said earlier, ancient kings first experienced the five desires and then renounced the householder’s life.

source_sentence: 此諸王等，今在何許？

source_sentence: 以愛欲故，或在地獄，或在餓鬼，或在畜生，或在人天；

source_sentence: 以有如是輪轉苦故，是以我欲離老病苦生死法耳。
translation: Because there's such a painful wheel of transmigration, it's because I want to be free of the suffering of old age, illness, and birth-and-death dharmas.

source_sentence: 汝今云何令我受之？』
translation: How will you now cause me to accept it?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷，雖竭才辯勸獎太子，不能令迴，即便退坐，歸於所止。

source_sentence: 太子仍勅嚴駕還宮，諸妓女眾，及優陀夷，愁憂慘慼，顏貌顰蹙，如人新喪所愛親屬；
translation: The prince then ordered the royal carriage to return to the palace. All the court ladies and Udayana were grieved and saddened, their countenance trembling like that of a newly deceased beloved relative.

source_sentence: 太子到宮，惻愴倍常。
translation: When the prince arrived at the palace, his compassion was even greater than usual.

source_sentence: 「時白淨王，呼優陀夷，而問之言：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：『出城不遠，逢見死人，亦不知其從何而來，太子與我，同時見之。
translation: Udāyin said,'Not far from the city, I met a dead man and didn't know where he came from. The prince and I saw him at the same time.

source_sentence: 太子問言：「此為何人？」

source_sentence: 我亦不覺，答是死人。』
translation: I don't even perceive it, answering that it's a dead man.'

source_sentence: 時王即復問諸從者：『汝等皆見城西門外有死人不？』
translation: The king then again asked the attendants, 'Do you all see a dead man outside the west gate of the city?'

source_sentence: 從者答言：『我等不見。』
translation: The attendant replied, 'We don't see it.'

source_sentence: 王聞此語，神意豁然，而自念言：『太子、優陀夷，二人獨見，此是天力，
translation: When the king heard these words, his spirits were enlightened and thought to himself, “Your majesty, prince, you and Udayana are alone in seeing this.

source_sentence: 非諸臣咎，必定當如阿私陀言。』
translation: It's not the fault of the ministers, but it must be as Asita said.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，心大苦惱，復增妓女，以娛樂之；
translation: Having thought thus, the king’s mind was overcome with great pain and distress. He also invited many court ladies to entertain him.

source_sentence: 日日遣人，慰誘太子，而語之言：『國是汝有，何故愁憂，而不樂耶？』
translation: Day after day, he sent someone to comfort the prince and told him, 'The kingdom belongs to you; why are you so sad and unhappy?'

source_sentence: 王又嚴勅諸妓女眾，悅太子意，勿捨晝夜。
translation: The king also ordered the court ladies to please the prince’s wishes and not give up their days and nights.

source_sentence: 「時白淨王，雖知天力非復人事，愛重太子，不能不言。
translation: At the time, King Śubhavyūha knew that his divine powers were no longer human and loved the prince, so he couldn't help but say.

source_sentence: 心自思惟：『太子前已出三城門，今者唯有北門未出，其必不久更求出遊；
translation: They thought to themselves, “Earlier the prince left the gates of the three cities but now there is only the northern gate that does not leave.

source_sentence: 當復莊嚴彼外園林，倍令光麗，勿使有諸不可意事。』
translation: You must also adorn the outer gardens and forests, make them even more radiant and beautiful, so that there won't be anything unworthy.'

source_sentence: 如所思惟，具勅諸臣。
translation: As I thought about it, I instructed the ministers to do so.

source_sentence: 時王又復心自願言：『太子若出城北門時，唯願諸天，勿復現於不吉祥事，
translation: Again, the king said to himself, “When you leave the northern gate of the city, prince, please do not show such inauspicious signs.

source_sentence: 復令我子心生憂惱。』
translation: It will also cause my son to become sad and distressed.'

source_sentence: 既心願已，遂勅御者：『太子若出，當令乘馬，使得四望，見諸人民，

source_sentence: 光麗莊飾。』
translation: It's glorious and adorned.'

source_sentence: 「是時太子，啟王出遊；
translation: “Then the crown prince asked the king to go on a excursion.

source_sentence: 王不忍違，便與優陀夷及餘官屬，前後導從，出城北門。
translation: The king couldn't bear the disobedience, so he went out of the north gate of the city with Udayana and his other officials, led by them in front and behind him.

source_sentence: 到彼園所，太子下馬，止息於樹，除去侍衛，端坐思惟，念於世間老病死苦。
translation: When he arrived at the park, the prince dismounted from his horse and stopped at a tree. Removing his attendants and guards, he sat upright and thought to himself:

source_sentence: 時淨居天，化作比丘，法服持鉢，手執錫杖，視地而行，在太子前。
translation: The Śuddhāvāsadeva then transformed himself into a monk, dressed in the Dharma robes, carrying an almsbowl and holding a tin cane in his hand, looked at the ground and walked in front of the prince.

source_sentence: 太子見已，即便問言：『汝是何人？』
translation: Seeing him, the prince asked, 'Who are you?'

source_sentence: 比丘答言：『我是比丘。』
translation: The monk replied, 'I am a monk.'

source_sentence: 太子又問：『何謂比丘？』
translation: The prince also asked, 'What's meant by monk?'

source_sentence: 答言：『能破結賊，不受後身，故曰比丘。
translation: They replied, 'They're called monks because they can break the bonds of thieves and won't accept the latter body.

source_sentence: 世間皆悉無常危脆，我所修學，無漏聖道，不著色聲香味觸法，永得無為，
translation: The world is all impermanent and fragile, but what I cultivate is the pure noble path. Without attachment to form, sound, odor, taste, or touch, I will always attain unconditionedness.

source_sentence: 到解脫岸。』
translation: He reaches the shore of liberation.'

source_sentence: 作此言已，於太子前，現神通力，騰虛而去。
translation: Having said these words, he manifested his supernormal powers in front of the prince and flew away.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，諸從官屬，皆悉覩見。
translation: At the time, all the officials and servants saw him.

source_sentence: 太子既已見此比丘，又聞廣說出家功德，會其宿懷厭欲之情，便自唱言：『善哉！
translation: Seeing this monk, the prince heard that he had extensively explained the merits of leaving home, and united with his past feelings of disillusionment, he said, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 天人之中，唯此為勝，我當決定修學是道。』
translation: Among gods and humans, only this is superior; I will definitely cultivate this path.'

source_sentence: 作此語已，即便索馬還歸宮城。
translation: After he said these words, he asked for a horse and returned to the palace city.

source_sentence: 於時太子，心生欣慶，而自念言：『我先見有老病死苦，晝夜常恐為此所逼；
translation: The prince was delighted and thought to himself, “Formerly I saw the suffering of old age, sickness, and death. Day and night I always feared that I might be oppressed by them.

source_sentence: 今見比丘，開悟我情，示解脫路。』
translation: Now that I see a monk, I'll awaken my mind and show him the path to liberation.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，即自思惟方便，求覓出家因緣。
translation: After he had this thought, he thought to himself about the method of seeking the causes and conditions for leaving home.

source_sentence: 「爾時白淨王問優陀夷言：『太子今出，寧有樂不？』
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana asked Udayana, 'Now that the prince is coming out, how could there be happiness?'

source_sentence: 時優陀夷即答王言：『太子向出，所經道路，無諸不祥；
translation: Udayana then replied to the king, “The prince is on his way out. There are no inauspicious signs on the road that leads him there.

source_sentence: 既到園中，太子獨自在於樹下，遙見一人，剃除鬚髮，著染色衣，來太子前而共言語。
translation: When he arrived in the park, the prince was alone under a tree. He saw a man shaving his hair and beard, wearing dyed robes, coming before the prince to talk with him.

source_sentence: 言語既畢，騰虛而去，竟亦不知何所論說，太子因是嚴駕而歸。
translation: After they had finished speaking, the prince rose up into the air and departed. He did not know what he was talking about but returned home in an elegant carriage.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，顏容歡悅，還至宮中，方生憂愁。』
translation: At that point, his countenance was joyous and he returned to the palace, but then he became sad.'

source_sentence: 時白淨王，既聞此語，心生狐疑，亦復不知是何瑞相，深懷懊惱，而自念言：『太子決定捨家學道，
translation: Having heard these words, King Śubhavyūha had doubts in his mind and wondered what the auspicious sign was. Being deeply distressed, he thought to himself, “Your majesty, I am determined to renounce my household life for religious practice.

source_sentence: 又納其妃，久而無子，我今應勅耶輸陀羅，當思方便莫絕國嗣；
translation: I should now order Yaśodharā to think of expedient means so as not to cut off the kingdom’s heirs.

source_sentence: 復應警戒，勿使太子去而不知。』
translation: Again, you should be alert and not allow the prince to leave without knowing.'

source_sentence: 既作是念，如所思惟，即便勅於耶輸陀羅。
translation: Having had this thought, he did as he thought and ordered Yaśodharā to do so.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅聞王勅已，心懷慚愧，默然而住，行止坐臥不離太子。
translation: Having heard the king’s edict, Yaśodharā was ashamed and remained silent. He walked, stopped walking, sat, and lay down without leaving the prince.

source_sentence: 時王復增諸妙妓女，以娛樂之。
translation: The king then again increased the number of beautiful court ladies to entertain them.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子年至十九，心自思惟：『我今正是出家之時。』
translation: When the prince was nineteen years old, he thought to himself, 'Now is the right time for me to leave home.'

source_sentence: 而便往至於父王所，威儀庠序，猶如帝釋，往詣梵天，傍臣見已，而白王言：『太子今者來大王所。』
translation: He then went to his father, the king, and his manner was as dignified as that of Indra. When he went to Brahmā Heaven, his attendants saw him and said to the king, 'Now, prince, you've come to the great king.'

source_sentence: 王聞此言，憂喜交集。
translation: When the king heard these words, he was overcome with grief and joy.

source_sentence: 太子既至，頭面作禮；
translation: When the prince arrived, he bowed his head and face.

source_sentence: 爾時父王，即便抱之，而勅令坐。
translation: It was then that his father, the king, embraced him and ordered him to sit down.

source_sentence: 太子坐已，白父王言：『恩愛集會，必有別離，唯願聽我出家學道。
translation: When the prince had sat down, he said to his father, “There will surely be a separation. All we ask is that you allow me to renounce household life and study the path.” The king said:

source_sentence: 一切眾生，愛別離苦，皆使解脫。
translation: All sentient beings are freed from the suffering of separation by craving and cause them to be liberated.

source_sentence: 願必垂許，不見留難。』
translation: May it be granted, and I won't see any difficulty in staying.'

source_sentence: 時白淨王聞太子語，心大苦痛；
translation: When King Baijing heard the prince’s words, great pain and distress arose in his heart.

source_sentence: 猶如金剛摧破於山，舉身戰掉，不安本座，執太子手，不復能言，啼泣流淚，

source_sentence: 噓唏哽咽。
translation: He exclaimed and choked, swallowing.

source_sentence: 如是良久，微聲而言：『汝今宜應息出家意。
translation: After such a long time, he said in a subtle voice, 'Now, you should calm the mind of renunciation.'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 年既少壯，國未有嗣，而便委我，曾不迴顧。』
translation: As he was young and strong, the kingdom had no heir, so he entrusted it to me without ever looking back.'

source_sentence: 爾時太子既見父王流淚不許，還歸所止，思惟出家，愁憂不樂。
translation: Seeing his father, the prince wept in tears and refused to allow him to return home. He thought of leaving home but felt disheartened and unhappy.

source_sentence: 「爾時迦毘羅斾兜國，諸大相師，占知太子，若不出家，過七日後，得轉輪王位，

source_sentence: 王四天下，七寶自至。
translation: He ruled over the four quarters of the empire and possessed all the seven kinds of treasure.

source_sentence: 各以所知，往白王言：『釋迦種姓，於此方興。』
translation: Knowing this, each of them went to the king and said, 'The Śākya clansmen are born here.'

source_sentence: 王聞是語，心生歡喜，即勅諸臣并釋種子：『汝聞相師如此言不？

source_sentence: 皆應日夜侍衛太子，於城四門，門各千人；

translation: Outside the city, he surrounds it for one yojana and puts his troops inside to guard it.'

source_sentence: 復勅耶輸陀羅并諸內官，倍加警戒，過於七日，勿使出家。
translation: Again, he instructed Yaśodharā and the other internal officials to double their alertness and precepts for more than seven days so that they wouldn't leave home.

source_sentence: 時王又來至太子所，太子遙見，即往奉迎，頭面禮足，問訊起居。
translation: The king then came again to the prince, saw him from a distance, went to meet him, bowed his forehead and feet, and greeted him.

source_sentence: 王語太子：『我昔既聞阿私陀說，及眾相師，并諸奇瑞，必定知汝不樂處世。
translation: The king said to the prince, 'In the past, I've heard what Asita taught, the masters of signs and other miraculous signs, and I'll surely know that you won't be happy in the world.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，聞父王言，心自思惟：『大王所以苦留我者，正自為國無紹嗣耳。』
translation: It was then that the prince heard what his father said, and he thought to himself, 'That's why the great king so painstakingly stayed with me, precisely because there's no successor in the kingdom.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，而答王言：『善哉！
translation: After he had this thought, he replied to the king, 'Good!

source_sentence: 如勅。』

source_sentence: 即以左手，指其妃腹，時耶輸陀羅，便覺體異，自知有娠。
translation: Yaśodharā then pointed to the queen’s belly with his left hand and said, “I am pregnant.” At that moment Yaśodharā became aware that her body was different.

source_sentence: 王聞太子如勅之言，心大歡喜，當謂太子七日之內，必未有兒，若過此期，
translation: The king was greatly delighted to hear that the prince would do as he had been told and thought, “Within seven days you will surely have no children. If you go beyond this time, I shall not be able to repay your kindness.” Having said so, the king agreed with the king’s request.

source_sentence: 轉輪王位，自然而至，不復出家。
translation: The throne of the cakravartin king came naturally and he renounced household life.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子心自念言：『我年已至一十有九，今是二月，復是七日，宜應方便，

source_sentence: 思求出家。
translation: He thought about leaving home.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 今正是時，又於父王，所願已滿。』
translation: Now is the right time, and what I wished for my father has been fulfilled.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，身放光明，照四天王宮，乃至照於淨居天宮，不令人間見此光明。
translation: After he had this thought, his body radiated a light that shone brightly and illuminated the palaces of the four heavenly kings up to the palaces of the Śuddhāvāsa gods, causing no one to see their light in between.

source_sentence: 爾時諸天見此光已，皆知太子出家時至；
translation: When the gods saw this light, they all knew that the time had come for the prince to renounce household life.

source_sentence: 即便來下，到太子所，頭面禮足，合掌白言：『無量劫來，所修行願，
